fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sending a REST API to create issue will fail when the value of description exceeds 10323 characters.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Prepare a Json file that contains value for description more than 10323 characters
# Run CURL command:
#* {noformat}curl --request POST --url 'https://<Cloud URL>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue' --user email:token  --header 'Accept: application/json'  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data @descriptionValue.json {noformat}

h3. Actual Results

Error message will be shown.
{noformat}
{"errorMessages":["We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file."],"errors":{}}
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

Issue is created.

h3. Notes

It is possible to insert characters up to 32767 to description field when users create the issue from the UI.
fields.summary: Create issue through REST API failed with error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you click on an image attachment that is added to an issue using iOS application, the image won't be previewed and will be downloaded directly. While if the same image is uploaded through web interface it will be previewed when you click on it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access an issue using JIRA iOS application
# Upload an image to the issue.
# Access the issue using a browser (in PC) and click on the uploaded attachment

h3. Expected Results
The image attachment is being previewed

h3. Actual Results
The image will be downloaded directly

h3. Notes
* Tested for images with JPG and PNG extensions.
* The image attachments could be previewed when accessing through iOS app or mobile browser.
fields.summary: Unable to preview images that are uploaded using Jira mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, Jira cloud mail server doesn't content scan to check for malicious files/attachments in the incoming mails. All that process does is check that the tenant and mailbox exist before submitting the message to Jira.

It would be good to enable antimalware protection on the Jira Cloud default mail server to filter the attachments/files in case malicious files are attached in the emails.

h3. Workaround
Using custom mail handlers instead of Jira cloud default mail handler will partially solve the problem. However, the emails could be sent to your Jira instance from anywhere.
fields.summary: Enable Antimalware Protection on JIRA Cloud default mail server

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When searching for "STATUS CHANGED BY", instead of suggesting usernames, it's suggeting status names.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

To reproduce:
# Go to the advanced search page.
# type "status changed by" and then a space.

*Expected:* suggestions from a list of users that changes as you type.

*Actual:* suggestions show the Status field values.

h3. Workaround
If you happen to know the full username/email/exact spelling and can type it, the search work
fields.summary: Searching for STATUS CHANGED BY is suggesting status names instead of usernames

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 1 April 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

We are currently transitioning all users on the old issue view in Jira Cloud products (Jira Software, Jira Service Desk, Jira Core) to the new issue view. You can read more about the new issue view [here|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/what-is-the-new-jira-issue-view/]. 

Thank you to everyone who has provided feedback on the new issue view. Your feedback has been used to identify and prioritise feature requests and enhancements. The tickets on our short term roadmap have been moved to _in progress_. You can see these tickets in the subtasks below or in a single view [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?filter=102236]

Thanks

Tha Atlassian Cloud team
{panel}
As more features move to our roadmap, we'll update the subtasks of this issue to let you know what's changed.

You can also stay up to date and get more info about the new issue view by watching [the new Jira issue view page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html] in our documentation.

*Note:* What is and isn't a distinct feature can be tricky to define, especially in something as involved as the issue view. We'll do our best to capture things as accurately and comprehensively as possible.
fields.summary: New Issue View in Jira Cloud
Allow user rest api endpoint to be queried using emailAddress

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Create linked issue does not respect custom field config scheme context


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a select list custom field
# Create a new context so there are 2 and assign each context to a project and provide different values/option
# Set default value for each context
# Mark field as required in field config for both projects
# Note when creating an issue in each project now they have different values and a set default value according to the context
# Create a linked issue
# Note the default values are not respected, it chooses the first valuy as opposed to the default or none


h3. Expected Results
The default option defined in the field context should be chosen


h3. Actual Results
The first option is selected regardless of the chosen default
 
h3. Notes
Also effects radio buttons, sometimes an incorrect value is chosen, other times no value is chosen

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Create linked issue does not respect custom field config context default values

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Field applicable context menu summary does not display selected issue types


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a fields applicable context and select a specific issue type
# Save
# Notice on the field context summary the chosebn issue type is not displayed

h3. Expected Results
The selected issue types for that congtext are displayed like the project is

h3. Actual Results
The issue types field remaains empty on screen which means the user must then click on the conterxt condfiguration to see which issue types the context applies to
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Field applicable context menu summary does not display selected issue types

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users are encountering the error *Unable to find field 'customfield_xxxxx'* after deleting a custom field. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a warning before deleting a custom field when it is in used by any workflow post-function. 

h3. Why this is important

Administrator may delete the custom field without knowing that it is actually used by a workflow configuration. Users are later on blocked from creating or transitioning issues with the error *Unable to find field 'customfield_xxxxx'*
 
h3. Workaround 

To recover from the error, inspect the workflow transition that is failing and remove any post-function that has a reference to the deleted custom field.
fields.summary: Workflow usage warning when deleting custom fields

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*

JIRA Mobile isn't rendering table from JIRA issues
h3. *Steps to Replicate*
 # Include table on Summary/Comments on a JIRA issue
 !Screen Shot on 2018-10-01 at 1.56.53 PM.png|width=414,height=253!
 # View from JIRA mobile app

h3. *Expected Result*
Table visible on the JIRA mobile App

h3. *Actual Result*

!IMG_2155.png|width=201,height=357! !IMG_2156.png|width=201,height=357!
fields.summary: Table isn't rendering on JIRA mobile apps

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Currently, when looking for documentation related to the Jira Cloud bot for Slack we find reference to @jirabot but in practice the username is simply @jira. 


h3. Where to change? 
# We can find this on the Atlassian official documentation: [Jira Cloud for Slack|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/jira-cloud-for-slack-950819031.html]
# We also can find this in the actual text provided by the Jira bot on the Slack app directory: 
#*   !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note: 
* Please check notes in the internal comment below.
fields.summary: documentation referring wrongly to Jira Cloud bot for Slack as @jirabot

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Right now when there is a problem with the Jira/Slack integration error messages such as "Something went wrong! Please try again later." will be posted on Slack channels

h3. Suggested Solution
Manage error messages in a separated place, maybe a dedicated channel or a page.

h3. Why this is important
Those error messages not only disrupts the work of users on the channel but it also adds unnecessary data on the channel.
fields.summary: Jira/Slack integration should not post error messages on Slack channels

fields.description:
This is a feature request for the [Message Field custom field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-add-a-message-or-field-on-jira-create-issue-screen-759990667.html].

I want the same text in both the view and edit of my issue.   In the view it works brilliantly, but in the edit, the name of the field shows up next to it.  This should be removed and it should display the same way as the Message Field (View) works.
fields.summary: Message Field (Edit) should work the same way as Message Field (View)

fields.description:
Summary
 Jira is not using the Profile Settings language settings when Spanish is selected.

Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a Cloud instance with "español (España)" set as default language
 # Go to Profile Settings
 # Profile is set to "español (España)", but content is still displaying in English

Expected Results
 Content displayed in Spanish

Actual Results
 Content is displayed in English

Workaround
 Change langage settings to "español", then change it back to "español (España)", and it should display content in Spanish correctly.

[.gif with the workaround|https://dha4w82d62smt.cloudfront.net/items/2g0j030O3G383x0O1a31/Screen%20Recording%202018-09-28%20at%2002.30%20PM.gif]
fields.summary: Jira not using profile settings when set to Spanish

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

After you set a default value to a message field *(for view)*, and then go back to edit it, you'll notice that the original value is converted in HTML.
If you save as it is, it will render everything in text since the view wont support HTML.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a *Message Custom Field (for view)*;
# Set the default value as the following:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-28 at 14.29.43.png|thumbnail!  
# Add it to a screen;
# See the result:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-28 at 14.31.11.png|thumbnail! 
# Go back to the field's configuration, and edit the default value. Notice that it is displayed with HTML tags instead of wiki:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-28 at 14.31.05.png|thumbnail! 
# If you save as it is, of course, the whole content will be rendered as plain text:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-28 at 14.31.24.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The default value should be displayed as it was originally set (wiki).

h3. Actual Results

The content is displayed in HTML instead of keeping the original format.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Message's field default value is converted to HTML

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Issue Collector page (under a specific project) breaks when the language is set to Français (France). Only the first issue collector is shown, and all the options under "Actions" are not shown. This means that it is not possible to Edit or Delete the Issue Collector.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

There might be other steps to reproduce the issue, but I managed to successively replicate it with these set of steps.
 # Go to a project, create a new issue collector. Add the required fields such as *Name* and *Reporter*, other fields can be left to default.
 # Ensure that your language in your *Personal Settings* is set to English.
 # Copy the HTML code for the newly created Issue Collector. Create a HTML file, and embed the code inside it.
 # Open the HTML file, and Submit an issue through the Issue Collector.
 # Now, go to your *Personal Settings*, and change your language to Français (France).
 # Go back to the created HTML file, and submit another issue using the Issue Collector.
 -- Here, note that the Fields and Descriptions in the Issue Collector is displayed in French.
 # While the language is still set to French, go to the Issue Collector page. The URL of the page should be something like this:
 -- {code}https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewCollectors!default.jspa?projectKey=<project-key>{code}

h3. Expected Results

The Issue Collectors page will be rendered correctly.
 !issuecollector-english.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Only the first Issue Collector is displayed, and the rest of the page is not shown.
 !issuecollector-french.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue Collector page does not render correctly when using a different language besides English

fields.description: It would be handy to provide the ability for board admins to implement a sort order within swimlanes. For example, if swimlanes are based on status, then within each swimlane, there should be an option to define a sort order so that issues with high priority comes on top and lower priority ones on the bottom.
fields.summary: Ability to implement sort within swimlanes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Activity Stream limit error when user's profile is set in PT-BR

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Browse to a dashboard.
# Add the gadget Activity Stream.
# Change a user's profile language to *português (Brasil)*.
# Click on edit under the gadget Settings.

h3. Expected Results
Able to edit and save the gadget configuration.

h3. Actual Results
On the UI we can't define the limit of items and shows the below error:
* *The limit of items must be a number between 1 and 99*

h3. Notes
I was not able to reproduce the error on other foreign languages like Spanish, English UK.

h3.Workaround
You can change the user's profile to English, edit the gadget and then revert back to Portuguese.
fields.summary: Not able to set the limit of gadget Activity Stream

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * If the cloud site has more than one field with the same name:
 ## two or more different custom fields with the same name.
 ## one default field and one custom field that has the same name as the default field.
 * > the *Value Field condition* will show only one of the fields and will not show the rest.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two custom field with the same name *RadioHERE*
 # one custom field is of type *Radio button* and another of type *select list*.
 # go to a workflow and try to add a condition to a transition.
 # Select the condition *Value Field*
 # search for the custom field *RadioHERE* among the list.

h3. Expected Results
 * Find all the fields with that specific name among the choices.

h3. Actual Results
 * Find only one field

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 * Rename the custom field name.
fields.summary: I am a Jira admin and I have fields with the same name in my site, Value Field condition will show only one of them.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Importing a Jira backup in to an existing Cloud instance with Confluence will cause all Confluence spaces/pages that were watched previously to no longer be watched after the restore is completed

h3. Environment
 
* Atlassian Cloud instance with both Jira and Confluence active

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Cloud insance with both Jira and Confluence active, watch a page or space in Confluence
# Import a Jira site backup

h3. Expected Results

Jira data is imported and Confluence pages that were watched previously continue to be watched by the same user accounts

h3. Actual Results

Confluence pages that were being watched before the import are no longer watched after the import is completed.

h3.Workaround

Manually re-add user accounts as watchers
fields.summary: Jira import wipes watchers for Confluence spaces/pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, in the CRM for Jira Cloud add-on, if the email of a reporter in Jira matches the one of a contact in Hubspot, Jira will auto-link the issue to the corresponding Contact.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to disable the feature of auto-mapping.

h3. Why this is important

More flexibility to users who use the integration so that they can map each issue to a specific Contact in Hubspot.
fields.summary: Allow users to disable auto-mapping of Reporters in Jira with Hubspot Contacts

fields.description:
h6. Problem Definition
* I have the CRM for Jira Cloud add-on and I want to create a Jira issue directly from HubSpot so that when a HubSpot user (usually a Support Agent) determines a Jira ticket needs to be created, they can do it right from the individual ticket in HubSpot and not have to leave the platform. 

h6. Why this is important
* Makes the support team work easier and faster. 

h6. Workaround 
* Currently, the support have to leave the HubSpot platform and create a Jira issue directly on the Jira platform.
fields.summary: As a CRM for Jira Cloud add-on user I want to create Jira issues directly from HubSpot

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer not able to sync tasks, issues and projects in between two instances.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to sync tasks, issues and projects in between two instances.

h3. Why this is important
Customers using multiple instances where one or many of the instances are used by offshore teams.
fields.summary: Ability to sync tasks and issues between two instances.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, users who have integrated their Jira Cloud instances with Hubspot, using the [Jira CRM Integration|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217661/crm-for-jira-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] app, are only able to see linked issues in the Contact page in Hubspot. The Company page does not show issues linked with that company.
* !t_awddw.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the same functionality available on the Contact page in Hubspot to the Company page.
* !Google.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
 
More options to visualize the issues linked with Hubspot for customers that use that integration. Better management of the integration between the applications.
fields.summary: Display linked issues in the Company page on Hubspot

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When importing large MP4 file using the new Media Picker in Jira when using the 'clip icon' on the issue view, the upload may fail, because:
* The file needs to be converted
* The browser needs to wait for the conversion, which may take several minutes in some cases

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to attach a large MP4 file (replicated with a 40MB file) using the new Media Picker
*This cannot be replicated in Jira's old attachment upload tool, only in the new Media Picker*

h3. Expected Results
The file is uploaded

h3. Actual Results
The file is not uploaded, the progress bar never finishes, though it reaches the end:
!attaching.png|thumbnail!

There's the 'Insert 1 file' in the window, but clicking it redirects us to the issue view page were the problem actually persists:
!attaching2.png|thumbnail!

It won't finish and refreshing the page makes the attachment disappear (as it was never really attached).

This same problem happens across different instances with the same file.

We can see several 404 in Network tab in browser and errors in JS Console:
{code}
{"error":{"code":"NotFoundError","title":"The file with the given id does not exist","href":"https://api.media.atlassian.com#NotFoundError"}}
{code}

h3.Workaround
It's possible to add the attachment in a comment. It doesn't fail when importing in a comment, even using the Media Picker.
fields.summary: MP4 attachment import may fail in new Media Picker

fields.description:
In the new issue view, the _Created_ and _Updated_ are no longer timestamps, but relatives (yesterday, 4 hours ago etc.).

When hovering over this field to get the actual timestamp, it is displayed slightly higher than the field itself.

Issue best described in the GIF attached:

!Hover bug.gif!
fields.summary: created date timestamp displayed slightly offset

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When copying a link that ends with "/" (bar) from the description of an issue that's using the old issue view into the description of an issue using the new issue view, it won't be possible to save the content.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # The old issue view has the following in the description: [https://www.atlassian.com/test/|https://www.atlassian.com/test/*] :

 * Ctrl + c -> paste into another issue's description (using the new issue view) -> hit *Save* -> nothing will happen:
 ** The following error can be found upon inspecting the browser:
{code:java}
{errorMessages: ["Failed to convert HTML to WikiMarkup"], errors: {}}
errorMessages: ["Failed to convert HTML to WikiMarkup"]
0: "Failed to convert HTML to WikiMarkup"
errors: {}
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The description will be saved.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens when hitting *Save*.
h3. Workaround

Remove the "/" (bar) from the end of the link (e.g. [https://www.atlassian.com/test/] -> [https://www.atlassian.com/test]).
fields.summary: Copying link from old issue view's description into the new issue view will prevent it from being saved

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 4 March 2021}
Hi everyone,

The resolved date and time is now available in the new issue view. You can see this below the created and updated date and time. Clicking on these dates will switch between absolute and relative time. We will also be releasing the ability to edit the resolution field shortly - this is tracked via https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-69556

Kind regards,

Atlassian
{panel}
h3. Summary

The resolved time for an issue is missing in the new Jira issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Resolve an issue
 # Check the time of resolution within the issue view

h3. Expected Results

The resolve time should appear together with the created and updated time.

!resolve old.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

!resolve missing.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

The resolution time can been seen on the Activity history on the new Jira issue view.

!activity.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: resolved date missing on the new jira issue view
Fields Configuration Screen is partially translated

fields.description:
h1. Investigating
We are investigating increased error rates for some Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud customers. We will provide more details shortly.

h1. Identified
We have identified the root cause of increased error rates for some Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud customers. We are working with our external service provider to resolve the issues. We will provide another update shortly.

*Update: 26th September 08:25 UTC* 
We continue to work with our service provider, AWS, to resolve the root cause of increased error rates for some Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud customers. We will provide another update shortly. 

h1. Resolved
Between 07:10 UTC to 08:56 UTC, Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud customers experienced connectivity issues to their instance. The root cause was identified as a networking issue with our service provider. The issue has been resolved and the services are now operating normally.

h3. Please watch this ticket to receive further updates.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud Outage

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When a filter subscription runs, the next send date does not get updated.

h2. How to reproduce
# Create a Jira filter
# Add a subscription to the filter
# Allow the subscription run

h3. Expected behavior
After the subscription runs, the *next send* date gets updated to the next time the filter runs

h3. Actual results
After the subscription runs, the *next send* date does not gets updated to the next time the filter runs. It still shows the last run date

h2. Workaround
Currently none
fields.summary: Jira filter subscription not updating next send date

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the Resolution field is set as *Hidden* in the field configuration, it will cause Unresolved issues to not be displayed in the "Assigned to me" gadget.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Assign an issue to yourself.
# Make sure that the issue has no value for the "Resolution" field.
# Make the "Resolution" field *Hidden* in the Field configuration.

h3. Expected Results

Since the issue has no value for "Resolution", the issue should be displayed in the Gadget.
* !System_dashboard_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Issues are not displayed in the Assign to me Gadget.
* !System_dashboard_-_Jira-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Alter the Field configuration to *Show* the Resolution field.
fields.summary: Issues are not displayed in the "Assigned to me Gadget" if Resolution is Hidden in the Field Configuration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Currently, it is possible to set the log retention period on Jira Audit log for 1 month, 3 months or 6 months. 
* I want to have the option to set the retention period to 1 year. 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide 1 year of audit logs. 

h3. Why this is important
 * Our auditors are requesting to have 1 year of logs for auditing/security purposes. 

h3. Workaround 
* Currently, there is no workaround. 

h6. Extra note: 
* Please check internal comment for further details.
fields.summary: As a Jira administrator I want to set Jira Audit log retention period to 1 year as requested by auditors

fields.description:
Currently the autocomplete feature on the labels field only searches for labels from the beginning of the label.

E.g. Typing "Comp", will suggest "Comparison" but not "ProductComparison", or "StoreComparison"

Desired behaviour would be for the typed string to be searched for anywhere in the label. Then using the example above, typing "Comp" would bring up all of the referenced labels as suggestions.
fields.summary: Improve autocomplete on labels field

fields.description:
In the new issue view, the created date and updated date are shown as 'X days ago' or 'X hours ago'.

It is more useful to have these fields as date / time stamps, like in the old view:

!old new.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: created date and updated date should be date/timestamps instead of 'x days ago'

fields.description: At the moment, there currently isn't any way to change the icons associated with each instance in the Instance Switcher dropdown menu. If you can customize these icons, it would be a much better user experience overall.
fields.summary: Allow for the customization of instance icons in Jira Cloud Mobile

fields.description: When adding links to an issue, and filtering the list, the item should be selected if only one is available, to allow users to just hit Enter, to add it.
fields.summary: One item should be automatically selected

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The user wants to prevent the use of other languages.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow uninstalling of language packages.
fields.summary: Disable languages packages or prevent their selection

fields.description:
When browsing issues in the backlog, and clicking on a link (either in the links section, or in the description), it opens it in a new tab.

It could open it in the detail view panel.
fields.summary: Links should not navigate away from backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user has the '*Assign User*' permission but not the '*Edit Issue*' permission they are no longer able to assign users under the new issue view due to the 'Assign' button no longer being present.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user within a project (that has new issue view).
# Assign this user '*Assign User*' permission.
# Ensure they do not have '*Edit Issue*' permission.
# Check they have all other permissions required to view the issue. 
# Open an issue in the new issue view and try to change the assignee.

h3. Expected Results
The assignee field should be editable or the assign button should be present. The use should be able to change the assignee field without the '*Edit Issue*' permission. 

h3. Actual Results
The assignee is not editable nor is the assign button present. The user requires the '*Edit Issue*' permission.
 
h3. Notes
New issue view only

h3.Workaround
Switch back to the old issue view as this makes the '*Assign*' button viewable again, or grant the '*Edit Issue*' permission to the user.
fields.summary: Assign User permission not being respected in new issue view

fields.description:
When adding a linked issue, you have to
 # select the link type
 # select the issue you want to link
 # manually click the Link button, or Tab to move the focus to the button then Enter

It would be great, to save it with Ctrl+Enter (as everywhere else)
fields.summary: Save issue link with keyboard

fields.description: The new Jira issue view provides no way to see the activity on an issue. The activity is important to understand what has happened to an issue (fields being edited etc), where a comment is not added. This was a useful feature of the old issue view.
fields.summary: New issue view activity tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Webhook on group:
# removal
# add
# update
-- name
-- members
-- permissions.

h3. Background
Such webhook would help us:
- invalidate caches containing Jira groups data,
- maintain internal security settings of our products based on Jira groups
fields.summary: Webhook on group changes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Updating / Editing / Deleting multiple issues in one bulk REST API request.

h3. Background
Our product provides users with Gantt chart that synchronizes Gantt task start/end date with Jira issue date fields. Moving task with dependencies on Gantt recalculates start/end dates of dependent tasks and synchronizes them back to JIRA.
Consequently moving single task on Gantt may result in an update of hundreds of issues.
This is a common scenario in our product.

Bulk issue update would improve the user experience of our product, therefore made it more attractive to enterprise customers with lots of tasks in project portfolios.
fields.summary: Bulk issue edit REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing Epics in the new issue view, the epic name field is not shown.
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Epic, and set the Epic Name field.
 # view the epic in the new issue view.

h3. Expected Results

The Epic Name field is available.
h3. Actual Results

The Epic Name field does not show up.
h3. Notes
 * Epic Color field isn't visible as well

h3. Workaround

Use the Old Issue view
fields.summary: Epic Name system field does not show up in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Use the new issue view and have an app that has web panels or the new jiraIssueContents
# Create a new issue.
# Go to the issue page.
# Wait 5-15 mins or more.
# Select the app's webpanel to be displayed.
# Error is displayed, see attached video: [^unauthorized-demo.mp4] 

Vendor notes:
{quote}
We believe the reason for this is that the JWT token that is used to communicate with the app is generated when the issue page is finished loading and it only lasts 3 mins, this is fine for web panels that are already in the issue page, but for web panels that the client chooses to add after the 3mins have passed the error is displayed and the client is forced to refresh the page.
This is causing our clients to receive many errors since in the new issue view every time a new issue is created they have to add the web panels all over again, we consider this to be a bug as well.

This error was already happening before the new issue view was implemented and it also happens on other occasions.
{quote}
fields.summary: "Authentication request has expired" when opening webpanel in New Issue View
Update comment REST API requires comment body even if the documentation says otherwise

fields.description:
h3. Summary

For some instances, Sprint custom field of Sub-tasks are not being populated with the correct value, hence, the REST APIs does not return Sprint information. The UI shows the correct value but the REST APIs return empty.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Task and a Sub-task
 # Add the Task to a sprint (the sub-task should inherit the value)
 # Call [Get issue|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-api-3-issue-issueIdOrKey-get] REST API

h3. Expected Results

The sprint information
h3. Actual Results

The value {{null}} is returned for the custom field.
h3. Notes ([~iragudo])
 * In the Jira issue view the sprint information for sub-task is displayed (see sub-task.png), but in REST API response there isn't this information (sub-task.json). For the parent issue, the sprint information is returned in REST API (parent.json)
 * Expanding {{versionedRepresentations}} in a Get issue call for erroneous sub-tasks shows that item 1 is null and item 2 is correct.
 * So far this is consistent in some instances only. I've tried in a newer instance and I cannot replicate the issue.
 * Using the JSW Cloud's Get issue REST API also behaves the same i.e. null value for sprint custom field which makes me think that the error happens when the sprint information is being inherited by the sub-tasks.
 * -This JSW Cloud issue seems related JSWCLOUD-15530-
fields.summary: Jira Cloud REST API doesn't return Sprint custom field information for sub-tasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary

I, as Jira user, would like to be able to check via JQL, when a issue was added to a sprint.
This would be very useful, since adding to a sprint, causes a change of scope.

h3. Expected Results

1.) Search for issues using JQL
2.) Add a column with the date of the addition to the sprint.

h3. Actual Results

1.) Search for issues using JQL
2.) There is no option to check when it was added to the sprint.
fields.summary: Determine via JQL if an issue was added to the sprint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it is not possible to edit the worklog entries in the new issue view.

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement the ability to edit/delete, like the one from the old issue view:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-24 at 13.59.10.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Disable the new issue view. For that follow the steps below:
{panel}
 # Select your avatar and choose Profile
 # Turn off the New Jira issue view toggle under Labs{panel}
fields.summary: Ability to edit the worklogs in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Internet Explorer 11 cannot scroll or click on fields

h3. Environment
Windows 10
Internet Explorer 11

4 example users have the exact same version of IE 11 (version 11.285.17134.0) Update Versions 11.0.85 KB4457426.
Issue is not effecting Chrome or Firefox on these machines.
Two difference OS subversions across the 3 machines - Version 180 (OS Build 17134.385) and Version 180 (OS Build 17134.386).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View a ticket in Internet Explorer 11 and notice the scrollbar is missing and you cannot click on any text fields to edit.

h3. Expected Results
A scroll bar is displayed and users can edit fields by clicking on them

h3. Actual Results
Scrollbar is missing and users cannot edit fields
 
h3. Notes
* Only effects the old issue view


h3.Workaround
Only affecting IE11, use another browser if possible
fields.summary: Internet Explorer 11 missing scrollbar and users cannot edit fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the new jira issue view, the sub-tasks estimate information and time tracking widget are missing. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Story and set 2h for the original estimates
# Crete a sub-tasks under the Story and set the original time estimate to 1h
# View the Story

h3. Expected Results

As in the old issue view, the parent should show the estimates for itself and the sub-tasks.

 !with subtasks estimates.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Only the estimate for the parent issue can be displayed

 !no sub-tasks.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

The estimate aggregation seen on the parent issue on the old issue view is for viewing purposes only. This does not aggregate the actual time estimate data on the parent issue. At the moment, the new Jira issue view is not able to show the sub-tasks estimate in the parent issue but the the actual data shown is the correct time estimate for the parent issue.
fields.summary: Time tracking widget missing in the new issue view
Context variables are not available immediately when getting them from AP.context.getContext() in the New issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

When users take a screenshot using a phone and want to quickly "share to create" it with other Apps (ie. Gmail, Slack etc), Jira isn't in the list of supported Apps.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to easily share/create a new issue (iOS App)
fields.summary: Provide a feature to easily share/create a new issue (iOS App)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When changing the issue security for an issue, the issue history will not show the original value when changing from another non-empty value. When changing from a non-empty value to "none", the original value is shown. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a project with issue level security. It is optimal to use issue level security where "none" is a valid value and has multiple non-empty options. (be sure not to lock yourself out of your test issue!)
# create a test issue and change the "issue security" value between various different values and observe the issue history

h3. Expected Results

Issue history shows the original value and the new value.

h3. Actual Results
=== Example Issue ===
!Issue Example.png|thumbnail!
===

As you can see in the above image, the new value is the only one shown, and it is in the "Original value" position. The only exception is changing the value from a non-empty value to an empty one.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Jira Issue Security Level changes do not show original value properly
Hiding the Priority Field Breaks Filters

fields.description:
h3.Problem Definition
At the moment, the built-in Jira Cloud-Slack Integration widget is visible as long as the Integration has been configured to a Project.

h3.Suggested Solution
Add a feature which will allow administrators to configure which group or project role this widget is visible to!

h3.Why this is important
This feature will help users who has multiple users who use the same Slack workspace and Project to keep conversions or messages restricted to each group that work on the same  issue of the same Project.

h3.Workaround 
Use JIRA's [*issue-level security*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-issue-level-security-776636711.html] to completely hide the issue from view.
(/) hide the issue completely from view
(x) Not advisable If users are suppose to work on the same issue 

h3.Desired Solution
Make the Slack widget only to be visible based on Groups or Project Role, which will be available for configuration via the Jira-Slack Integration configuration page.
fields.summary: Hide Slack Widget on issue view based on Group or Project Role

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The issues searched with reference to created on startOfWeek() shows the issues created on Sunday and not Monday.

h3. Suggested Solution
The startOfWeek() must be configurable to the desired day.

h3. Workaround
No workaround found.
fields.summary: Ability to edit the startOfWeek() to a different day

fields.description:
h3. Summary
REST APIs to move issues just like the UI offers:
* between projects
* between issue types
* between parents (for subtasks)
fields.summary: Move issue REST API

fields.description: Allow the user the ability to delete an estimate entered from the Jira issue history. Sometimes a wrong estimate could be logged and upon correction, the users would need to remove the wrong estimate.

New issue view adds an unnecessary grey/white height at the bottom of an app's issue glance panel:
 * When there's a lot of content in a panel:
 * !Screen Shot 2018-09-21 at 8.22.07 AM.png|thumbnail!
 * When less content is in the panel:
 * !Screen Shot 2018-09-21 at 8.22.57 AM.png|thumbnail!
 * When not yet integrated or less content:
 * !Screen Shot 2018-09-21 at 8.23.28 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: App's Issue Glance has an unnecessary additional white/gray height appended

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Some system fields such as *Time estimate* or *Story point estimate* does not show up in the old issue view (they are empty or/and they are not listed in the screen config) but when I enable Lab feature on my profile to turn on the new issue view they permanently shows up and I cannot remove them. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# go to a software project. 
# ensure that the screen mapped to that project does not include the *Story point estimate* system field.
# go to a Jira issue and verify that the *Story point estimate* system field is not showing up. 
# go to your profile (your personal settings) and enable the Lab feature. 
# go back to the same Jira issue mentioned above.

h3. Expected Results
* We expect to not see the *Story point estimate* system field since it is not mapped to any screen. 

h3. Actual Results
* We see the *Story point estimate* system field with a *None* value. 
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-29 at 17.39.02.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* The same behavior is identified with *Time estimate* system field, *Fix Versions*, *Affects versions* and *Due date*. 

h3.Workaround
* Disable the new issue view for the now.
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-29 at 17.37.30.png|thumbnail! 
* Another to disable the new issue view: Profile Picture -> Personal setting -> Disable *Jira labs*
fields.summary: Some system fields show up in new issue view unexpectedly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the new issue view (using the new editor), users can't embed inline images using either the markdown or wiki markup syntax:
{noformat}
![Inline Image](http://example.com/image/example.png)
!http://example.com/image/example.png!
{noformat} 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add support for inline (embedded) images in the new editor

h3. Workaround 
Download the image and add it as an attachment.
fields.summary: Ability to embed external images using the New Editor

fields.description:
As a Jira project administrator, I want to be able to restrict the visibility of certain items on the left menu, such as "Reports," "Releases", "Pages", and "Components".

 !Screen Shot 2018-09-20 at 4.13.02 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a Jira project administrator, I want to be able to restrict the visibility of certain items on project's left menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a project with the template Project management, it automatically creates two shortcuts, Project management with JIRA and Business projects basics, the Project management with JIRA shortcut is redirected to a bad link.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Create a Project management template project;
# Click on the shortcut Project management with JIRA;
# Will redirect to the bad link.

h3. Expected results

The following page should be shown:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-20 at 11.39.59.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result

The bad link is shown:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-20 at 11.40.22.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Change the URL of the shortcut to https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/project-management-803373924.html
fields.summary: Shortcut bad link on Project management template

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira Service Desk does not appear to have a method to email all Customers at once, short of using the internal [How to send an email to all Jira users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-send-email-to-all-jira-users-776811096.html]. You would need to gather a list of emails of all Customers and send using this method, which isn't very convenient.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a method in Jira Service Desk to send a single email out to all Customers

h3. Why this is important

Soon we will be merging 2 JSD instances into 1. We need to do comms out to our user base on both JSD's of the upcoming merge and the short outage on the cutover day. 

We have added announcements on the Service Desks affected which is fine for users who visit in the week before the merge. 

However I would feel more re-assured if I was able to mail all customers from the Customers section of JSD to reach more customers before the outage. But I can't find any option to email all customers? Or even export all customer email addresses out to csv which would be a workaround.
fields.summary: Send email to all Service Desk Customers

fields.description:
Whenever a REST API call is made to Jira Cloud, the response contains the status line, something like:
{code:java}
HTTP/1.1 401 Forbidden
{code}
According to [RFC7230|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7230], (section 3.1.2) the textual phrase describing the status code (the 'Forbidden' in the example above) can be missing, or zero-length, but the space just after the status (401) must exist.

Jira Cloud sends the status line without the textual phrase and without the trailing space after the status. This does not comply with RFC7230 and can cause some automation issues.

Steps to reproduce:
Perform a GET request on a Jira cloud site, using --http1.1 as an argument.

Expected result: there is a trailing space after the status code:
 !trailingspace.png|thumbnail!

Actual result: the trailing space does not exist
 !nospace.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: REST API request response does not have a trailing space in the status line
Team (Portfolio) custom field isn't showing on new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

When opening Issue View by pressing period ( . ), it opens up dialog box with list of actions. When user opens an issue with lot of comment in the bottom, press ( . ), attempt to key in Epic Link value, the cursor stays at the bottom of the ticket.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Improve the experience by scrolling it up automatically and move the cursor to the selected action (ie. Epic Link field).

h3. Customer's use case

{quote}

You are viewing the issue which does have an Epic Link assigned so the field is present in the issue view
let's say issue has a bunch of comments and you've scrolled to the very bottom so you can't see the issue fields
You've decided to change an Epic Link
You press period (.), type Epic Link, press Enter
Expected result: 
i'd expect the page to scroll up so the Epic Link field is visible for me
moreover, i'd prefer my cursor be placed into the field automatically so i can type straight away
Actual result:
there's no scroll to field, you're still staying in the bottom of the issue view
if you scroll up, you'll see that Epic link field is activated, but you can't type in it, you need to place cursor first


This would be a huge timesaver as i often use quick editing in my workflows."
{quote}
fields.summary: Improve Dialog Box action

fields.description:
Please provide a documentation article that explains all the templates that one can choose when creating a project.

The article should contain the particularities of each template, such as workflows, issue types, permissions and the use scenario. Ideally, there will be a single document for all templates, as currently this information is scattered across multiple pages in different locations.
fields.summary: provide a documentation article that explains all project templates
Tabs failed to load when switching between tabs via drop down on the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Calling search REST API, status 500 {{FATAL: too many connections for role...}} was received.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Call REST APIs (in this sample Search) in continuous succession

h3. Expected Results

If the rate limit is hit, the status 429. Throttling limit state should be returned in headers like [here|https://developers.trello.com/docs/rate-limits]
h3. Actual Results

See attachment [^500_connections (1).txt]
fields.summary: 500 "FATAL: too many connections for role" caused by Edge malfunction

fields.description:
Environment OSX, Chrome 66.0.3359.139
Tooltip says " Press undefined"
fields.summary: Tooltip is incorrect on "update" button

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Currently, the same user that creates the generic application link will be the user impersonated by the third party application to use the REST APIs through OAuth.

h3. Security concerns
* This user has to have full administrator rights to create the integration, allowing the 3rd party application to get whatever information they want from the Cloud instance without the knowledge of the Jira/Site administrators, this scenario is for cases where the 3rd party app has malicious intentions.
* The administrators have no idea what are the details of the allowance provided to the 3rd party app, the administrator will have to allow *Read and Write* and it's not clear what is the scope of access in details.

h4. Suggestion
* Allow administrators to create the generic application link choosing which account will become impersonated, this way a properly scoped service account will be used with the proper access level set in site administration and permission schemes.
fields.summary: Improve security for generic application links for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On the New Issue view, when typing an issue key to create an issue link, it adds an invisible ( zwnj - zero-width non-joiner ) character on the issue key that prevents the link to be rendered. 

*This feature works properly on the "old issue view"*

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to an issue with the new issue view
# Add a comment with a valid issue key
# Save the comment

h3. Expected Results
The link should be created as expected

h3. Actual Results
It adds the following character: 

{code:java}
 ( ‌ )
{code}

 !zwnj2.png|thumbnail!  !zwnj.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround
Add a link to an issue manually on the editor using the *Add Link* button.
fields.summary: Linking an issue by typing the issue key adds a ZWNJ character on the new issue view

fields.description: It would be great to set 'do not disturb' times in the iOS mobile app for Jira notifications. This feature is already in the Android mobile app.
fields.summary: Do Not Disturb Feature on Jira iOS mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the option to add attachment directly to comment only available in "View Issue Screen" as per screenshot below :-

 !Screen Shot 2018-09-19 at 11.00.41 PM.png|thumbnail! 

As for "Resolve Issue Screen" , the option is not available. The user need to add "Attachment" field to the screen and need to manually add it to the comment after upload the attachment in "Attachment" field.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the option to add attachment in the comment directly as per "View Issue Screen" page.

h3. Why this is important
It makes the user easier to add the attachment when resolving the issue.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Allow to "Browse" and add a new attachment in comment field in "Resolve Issue Screen"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
High memory usage in Firefox after page refresh. Problem is specifically bad for JIRA reindex page is it refreshes pages very frequently. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA
* Firefox 62 - OSX 10.11.5 
* Firefox 62 - Windows 10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to JIRA re-index page, or view an issue.
# Wait until process finished.
# Check memory usage
* about::memory - https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Performance/about%3Amemory
* [Memory_profiling|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Performance#Memory_profiling_and_leak_detection_tools]

h3. Expected Results
Memory usage is low.

h3. Actual Results
Memory usage is high. It grows from 50MB to 300MB in my case. In a worth case it can be 2+GB. 
Memory usage:
 !PS_FF_active_reindex_mem.png|thumbnail! 
Memery snapshot of DevTools - usage grows:
 !PS_FF_active_reindex_snap.png|thumbnail! 
Snapshot of Activity Monitor in OS X:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-19 at 12.29.59.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
* Problem is not reproduceable in Chrome
* Problem happens with other JIRA pages in Firefox
* May be related to https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1141242

h3.Workaround

This workaround seems to vary, as the below fix might work or not depending on your machine or OS!
 * Refreshing the Current page by Pressing {{F5}} or the Reload button
 * Clearing the Browser Cookies
 * Clearing the DNS Cache
 * Use a Different Browser
 * Switch to the *new Issue view* (/)
* Use other browser
fields.summary: High memory consumption in Firefox after page refresh

fields.description:
Even though the Vote for the Issue button is available on the web application, users can't vote for an issue when using a Mobile app. 

It would be very helpful to this functionality on Mobile app.
fields.summary: Vote for the issue button isn't available on Mobile app

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Currently, the only way of adding an issue type to an *issue type scheme* demands a manual work, with the need of editing one issue type scheme at a time.

That becomes an even exhaustive task when there is a big number of issue type schemes in the instance.



h3. Solution

Add an option to edit multiple issue type schemes at the same time.

Perhaps, there could be an additional option in the issue types section (e.g. a button called *add to scheme(s)*), where it would simply display a list with all available issue type schemes with a checkbox next to them, so the user would simply need to check each checkbox (issue type scheme) and click on save to apply the associations.

Another alternative, a CSV import with such settings.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk update issue type schemes

fields.description:
Customers currently cannot turn off the _We're updating the issue view to help you get more done_ message 
!Screen Shot 2018-09-18 at 11.18.02.png|thumbnail! 

For customers that already want to keep using the new UI, and don't want to revert to the old view, this can be very annoying.
fields.summary: Ability to turn off the "We're updating the issue view to help you get more done" message

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In issue navigation detailed view, after ~3 minutes of idle time, selecting a different issue does not update the query parameters accordingly which results to a status 401 (either a different issue ID is passed to the selected one, or an expired JWT for the same issue).

h3. Environment
* FireFox 62.0.1
* Google Chrome 67.0.3396.99

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open JIRA filter view (with multiple issues in it). Select issue A - Zendesk plugin loads and display info correctly. 
# Wait ~3 minutes
# Select issue B (or any issue from what's present in the filtered view).
# Zendesk addon errors out.

h3. Expected Results
Status 200.

h3. Actual Results
Status 401 with stale query parameters. Attached  [^jira.zd-dev.com.har] as needed.

h3. Notes
At step 1, Jira loads: http://zendesk_addon_host.com/integrations/jira/app?issue_id=10103&issue_key=A

At step 3, we can see that Jira is trying to load the (Zendesk) addon via an invalid URL (http://zendesk_addon_host.com/integrations/jira/app?issue_id=10103&issue_key=A when we expect the issue_key to be B). (see image below)
 !incorrect_request.png|thumbnail! 

Server app - https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211941/zendesk-support-for-jira

h3.Workaround
Hard reload (Shift + Reload) the page.
fields.summary: Error rendering app iframe in filtered issues view

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Some file extensions won't be previewed in the new issue view.

Instead, there will be a message saying that it is not possible to preview.  It will display a button to download the file though (which works):
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-14 at 10.15.46.png|thumbnail! 



h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Attach a file to the issue:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-18 at 10.40.39.png|thumbnail! 
2. Select a CSV file (or docx, txt) -> *Insert*:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-18 at 10.42.34.png|thumbnail! 
3. Click on it in the issue view:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-18 at 10.43.48.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-09-18 at 10.43.56.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The new issue view was expected to be able to preview it.

h3. Actual Results

The new issue view won't be able to preview it.

h3. Notes: 
* Tested extensions (not previewed): 
** .TXT
** . DOCX
** .XLSX
** .CSV
** .PPTX
** .PNG
** .JPG (works intermittently)
** HEIC

* Known working extensions (previewed):
** .JPEG


h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: New issue View won't preview some attachments (extensions)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When *Logging Work* in a Jira issue, the History of the issue shows *Time spent* and *Remaining Estimate* twice. 
*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click *Log Work* or the "+"(plus sign) on the *Time Tracking* panel on the issue.
# Log any time.
# Check the *Issue History*
 

 
h3. Expected Results
* The *Time Spent* and *Remaining Estimate* should not appear twice.

 
h3. Actual Results
* The *Time Spent* and *Remaining Estimate* is duplicated.
fields.summary: Log work has duplicated entries in Issue History
Securitization

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The "webPanels" component used to be reloaded when the issue page refreshed (e.g. when the jira.refreshIssuePage() event was triggered).

h3. Environment
* New issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a connect app the uses webPanels (tested with location atl.jira.view.issue.left.context)
# Call AP.jira.refreshIssuePage()

Issue can be seen in this video: http://recordit.co/O6XRm3UP1W

h3. Expected Results
webPanels reload just like the old issue view

h3. Notes
The new web_panel associated with the "jiraIssueContents" component does not behave at the same way (i.e. it is not reloaded when the issue refresh) as the old issue view.
fields.summary: webPanels does not reload when jiraRefresh event is triggered

fields.description:
* Select the small/large gadget layout (Edit Layout -> 3rd layout)
 * Resize window to see how the text is not properly contained in the gadget box. See Screenshot.
fields.summary: Gadget layout causes text overflow

fields.description:
Currently, all the notifications on Jira are based on the Notification Scheme, and it's not possible to configure the system to send notifications just in one specific place, like not receiving emails and just being notified on the Jira Application.

So, it would be great to have the ability to chose where the notifications will be sent on the Notification Scheme, like the example below.
 * Notifications by email.
 * Notifications in-app (Just at the Jira Site).
 * Notifications on the Jira APP (Mobile).
 * Notifications of comments where the user is assignee/reporter under the Direct tab

It's important to have this ability to choose one or more options of where you will be notified to avoid email Spam of not necessary information.
fields.summary: Customize in-app notifications in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the New "full detail" Jira issue view, users lost the ability to edit previous work logs.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for users to edit previous work logs while viewing the issue in the "full detail" view.

Previous "full detail" issue view:
 !Previous.png|thumbnail! 

New "full detail" issue view:
 !Current.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
This should enhance greatly the user experience.

Also, now that the Work log tab has been removed, there is no way to verify the *Date started* of the work log, this is especially problematic when you've set a date in the past yet JIRA logs the entry as "2 minutes ago".

h3. Workaround 
You can temporarily disable the New Jira issue view in Business projects by clicking "See the old view" (on the top right corner of the screen).
fields.summary: As a user I'd like to edit a work log in the new issue view as I could before Work log tab

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users can create dashboards.
h3. Suggested Solution

Create a specific permission to allow only certain groups to create dashboards in the application.
fields.summary: Create a permission to restrict some groups/users to create dashboards
Better Keyboard Shortcuts for Jira Boards During Sprints

fields.description:
One of our public articles, [Changing Server ID for Test Installations|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/changing-server-id-for-test-installations-285839562.html], contains instructions about how to proceed when facing a specific problem in our server platform.

This situation, however, *also affects cloud*. 

It would be great to have this documentation reflecting both scenarios, providing our customers information about how to proceed in each different situation.

As a suggestion, I would add the following:
{quote}
h3. Server installation:
 * *All the information already provided*


h3. Cloud installation:
 * If problem is affecting a cloud instance, please contact our Technical support.
{quote}

That way, customers would now exactly how to proceed on both platforms, as sometimes not explicitly specifying if problem affects server or cloud causes confusion.
fields.summary: Update public Knowledge Base Article

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* The "Reequest Type" field doesn't appear in Jira Mobile

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add support for the "Request Type" field in JSD

h3. Why this is important
* Standard JSD field
* All JSD tickets _should_ have a value in the "Request Type" field
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Jira Mobile: Support for the "Request Type" JSD Field

fields.description:
You don't seem to be able to paste an image when you're including a comment while "adding a flag" to an issue.

I currently just open up the flagged comment again and paste the image there which works fine.

Workflow;
 * Right click an issue
 * Select "Add Flag"
 * Try and paste an image into the comments field
fields.summary: Include the ability to Copy and Paste images when adding a flag

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As of now, there is no information that add-ons users created in Cloud instance will not be included in the billing. These are part of the system users (with @connect.atlassian.com domain) which don't take up a license seat, even if they are granted with Application access.

Suggestion to add in the following documents or create a new one:
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-application-access-744721629.html]
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/billing-and-user-count-873871345.html]
fields.summary: Add information about add-ons users (system users)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When doing a site import, we can now opt to do the import without attachments and import the attachments later using the *Import Attachments* feature, to properly import the attachments, the folders within the zip file needs to follow a respective structure which is described in the [How to import only part of a Jira export into Jira Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/how-to-import-only-part-of-a-jira-export-into-jira-cloud-859461966.html]
{code}
attachments-only.zip
└─── data
      ├── attachments
      │         ├── ProjectKey
      │         │         └── 10000
      │         │		├── IssueKey-1
      │         │		├── IssueKey-2
      │         │       	└── IssueKey-3
      │         ├── ProjectKey2
      │         └── ProjectKey3
      └── avatars
{code}

When importing the attachments, if the folders inside the zip file aren't following exactly the structure above, e.g. the folder *10000* between the project key and issue key is missing, the import will complete and it will show a message that the import succeeded, however, the attachments aren't imported.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a verification before the import starts stating that the structure within the zip file isn't correct and show what's wrong in the backup folder, or at least show an error message with the page mentioned above informing to check the folder's structure within the backup making sure that they follow the exactly the same structure as the one described in the page.

h3. Why this is important
The import succeeded message after the import even when the attachments aren't correctly imported due to a wrong folder structure totally mislead with the actual result, therefore, it would be good to have this accurate message stating that the attachments actually weren't imported due to a wrong folder structure.
 
h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Show an error message accordingly when the Import Attachments fail to import the attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When linking an issue using [Issue Links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/linking-issues-779296002.html] through the *Edit Issue screen*, there will be two options to search for an issue:
# By clicking on the arrow on the drop-down menu,
# And by clicking on the "Plus" (+) icon beside the field.

 !issuelink1.PNG|thumbnail! 

The list of suggested issues are inconsistent between these two options.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure that the "Linked Issues" field is included in the "Edit Screen"
# Go the View Issue Screen, then, Click on "Edit"
# Look for the "Linked Issues" field. Below it, there should be an "Issue" field.
## Click on the downwards-arrow to see the drop-down menu. Observe the list of suggested issues.
## Click on the "Plus" (+) icon beside the field. Observe the list of suggested issues.

h3. Expected Results
The list of issues for both of these methods of choosing an issue should be consistent, as they are both based on a "History Search"

h3. Actual Results
The list of issues are different.
 !issuelink2.png|thumbnail!  !issuelink3.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The issue suggestion list (History Search) for issue linking shows inconsistent results

fields.description: Long field names make Jira search output messy. It would be great to offer the ability to specify a "column alias" for selected columns in a Jira search. For example, have the output show "Ref" as the column heading for the field "Reference Number". This is similar to the c_alias concept in SQL: {{SELECT 'Reference Number' AS 'Ref'}}.
fields.summary: Allow column alias in Jira search output

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Jira Server on the comments section if you copy a table from a xlxs file and paste it into the comment it will keep the formatting on the table but in Jira Cloud, the table will be pasted as an image instead of an editable table.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the Jira Cloud editor behave like the one available on Jira Server and allow the Copy/Paste of tables keeping the formatting.

h3. Why this is important
Many users rely on xlxs tables on their daily work and the current Copy/Paste function on Jira Cloud makes harder to insert data from tables into tickets adding complexity to the user job.
fields.summary: Improve Copy/Paste table function

fields.description:
We are currently in the process of converting over from another Help Desk system into JIRA, and are pretty paranoid about when the site sends out emails. It would be nice if there was a way to put the site in a 'dev' mode where no emails would be sent out, including customer/agent invitations.

Some of this can be done on a project-by-project basis, but it would be much more helpful to have an emergency kill-switch that would apply site-wide. Especially when you have 15+ projects. Peace of mind would go a long way.

EXAMPLE: We had an issue where a batch import of 3000 tickets emailed all the new requesters, months before we were ready to go-live. We thought emails had been disabled in that project, but there was a miscommunication.
fields.summary: A way to turn off ALL email on an entire Cloud site
